meanings.definition: To surpass in intelligence or cleverness.
meanings.sent1: She was able to outsmart her opponent in the chess game.
meanings.sent2: He tried to outsmart the tricky riddle, but it was too difficult.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox managed to outsmart the hunter by hiding in the bushes.
meanings.sent4: In the race of wits, she always finds a way to outsmart her competitors.
meanings.sent5: The detective used his sharp mind to outsmart the criminal and solve the case.

meanings.definition: To outwit or outdo in a clever manner.
meanings.sent1: The young inventor was able to outsmart the older engineers with her innovative design.
meanings.sent2: He tried to outsmart his opponents in the game by using unexpected strategies.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to outsmart the dog by climbing up a tree.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking allowed her to outsmart the tricky situation and come out on top.
meanings.sent5: The magician used his skills to outsmart the audience and leave them in awe.
